Fields.DialogueText: Ein... zwei... drei...
*CLICK*
What are you doing with that camera, Deutschland?
Lying in wait.
Um.
... For *photographs.* What did you think I'd be waiting for?
I don't know you well enough to be sure. And a lot of Belles are... well...
Let's just say you have more complexes than the Army.
Charming. But nein, Kapitän. I am not going to beat someone to death with my carefully calibrated Kamera.
That's what my armaments are for, nein?
... You said that with such a big smile.
And? Gibt es ein Problem, Herr Kapitän?
... Eh. What are you waiting for, then? A good photo op?
I'd like to catch one of our fellow ships in a moment of glory.
... Glory?
Ideally, glorious victory. If not, then a glorious death.
It's good for morale, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: Death photos... are good for morale?
You've got to help your motherland somehow.
I guess I can see that. Just don't let it get in the way of the fight.

Fields.DialogueText: They inspire us to be better. If a Belle gives her life for the struggle, we should avenge her.
I'll do it with my arsenal *and* my Kamera. And I hope, eventually, that I can do the same.
Indeed. And I hope to help with my Kamera *and* my arsenal.
Everyone has their part to play in the struggle. And I hope this is mine.
Of course I won't. Our victory is much more important.
But this is another part of the fight. And I hope to play my part in it, with my Kamera *and* my arsenal.
... You see your camera as a weapon?
I like weapons. They do exactly what you expect them to do.
My guns penetrate steel. My torpedos strike without warning. And my Kamera shows the truth.
... The truth, huh? Coming from a Nazi, that's a bit of a surprise.
Just *what* do my politics have to do with that?
Mm. The Reich puts a lot of effort into its propaganda, doesn't it?
Kapitän, we both know that you've permitted Walküren to participate in programmes to inspire the peoples of the world against the Nixen. Your face may even be on a poster or two as well.
*ALARM*
Oh! Here come my subjects.
Let me get my tripod.
Don't take too long, they're coming in hot!
@BATTLE
If you think I'm doing the job ineffectively, by all means say so! Otherwise, I fail to see your concern.

Fields.MenuText: It's the detachment when you talk about "heroic death" that makes me nervous.
Ugh. Let's not talk about the posters with my face on them.
I don't think the Propagandaministerium always chooses to send out particularly helpful messages.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, we've made great strides!
I guess that's one way of putting it.
Smile!
Ah! Are you "lying in wait" again?
Practice is the only way to improve, Kapitän.
Mind if I see some of the developed ones?
Go right ahead. I have some here.
Thanks. --Oh, these are good.
And they're only getting better!

Fields.MenuText: How do you find ways to keep your photography novel? I mean, with us being at sea most of the time, your options are limited.

Fields.DialogueText: It is not as hard as it sounds. Even out here, we are all constantly changing and growing. The photos are a way to record this.
Huh. Usually you're rigid about not changing.
One must always be prepared to seize the future in whatever form it takes. From that I have never deviated.
Well! I really must get back to my photography.
Go ahead. Anything you're after this time?
There's one thing I haven't managed yet...
*ALARM*
My lucky day! Maybe this time I'll catch a moment of glory.
Just don't let it wreck the lens – or you, for the matter.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Which one would you say is your favorite?

Fields.DialogueText: I would have to say... this one, without a doubt.
The one of the German flag? I should have known.
Of course you should have. That picture of the seagulls is fun, of course – not that it could ever stand up to the symbol of true order.
Wait, when you said "have to say," is that really your favorite, or just...

Fields.MenuText: Have you sent any back home?

Fields.DialogueText: Not... exactly. I've sent a few to Leni, and she's been supremely supportive-
If you want to put it that way, yes. I'm taking more pictures.
Leni...? Wait, Leni Riefenstahl? "Triumph of the Will" Leni Riefenstahl?
Ja! Ja, she's taken an interest in my humble photos - it's very flattering!
I don't know. You obviously know your way around a camera, and you're a national symbol in your own right.
I don't think anybody would say that she, of all people, couldn't recognize a propaganda angle when it sends her photos in the mail.
Schön wär's!
... I didn't necessarily mean that as a good thing. Take it from me, public symbols don't get a lot of latitude when it comes to expressing themselves.
Aber I'm a Walküre. I'm not *supposed* to have a lot of latitude.
Still no luck?
Mm. "Luck" has never been my best quality, Captain.
But I have to keep at it. Sooner or later, I'll get my moment of glory. On Kamera or off.
Just don't hurt yourself doing it.
I'll try not to. Yet.
Oh, don't give me that look. A glorious death for the cause is the best any of us can hope for.
... But I have other things to do first. Like get that photo.
Good. And is your cause really worth dying for?
You have some nerve saying that to my face.
I'm not talking about the Morgana War, you know. I'm talking about dying as a martyr to what's going on in Berlin.
Which is just as important! I don't know why you're making such a fuss!

Fields.MenuText: Call me crazy, but I think death is bad.
As far as I can tell, fascism is all about bullying your neighbors and saying they had it coming. You shouldn't want to die for it.
... There's no point in dying for people who don't care about you.

Fields.DialogueText: Aber-
You'll change your mind about *that*. Or I'll find a new Kapitän.
... When I was starting out, one of my commanding officers told me, "you may love the Navy, but the Navy will never love you back."
Mm. Maybe you should start asking around.
It's only bad if it's purposeless, Kapitän.
Let's agree to disagree.
No, I think you were still the right choice. I'll just have to train you out of it.
You may love your cause, but... Does it love you back?
Let's not.
*ALARM*
... Is it worth it to bring my Kamera to this fight?
You might get lucky.
I doubt it.
@BATTLE
Dun dun dun dun! Dun dun dun dun!
There you are. I was wondering where you had snuck off to.
Mm. I needed some quiet, Kapitän. I wanted to listen to the gramophone.
Makes sense. What's playing? It doesn't sound like one of your operas.
His Eroica – one of his greatest masterpieces.
It is certainly lovely. What makes it your favorite?
It has a sense of strength and ambition to it – the kind that our Nordic hearts beat to.
... This again, huh?
Dedicated to Prince Louis Ferdinand, who shed his German blood in the fight against the French!

Fields.MenuText: Which I'm pretty sure is exactly the sort of reverence the French used to talk about Napoleon with. Before he sent his armies east, anyway.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't get me started on Russia - or Napoleon. He was just a Frenchman - no, worse, a Corsican. In any case, we'll succeed where he failed.
... Okay, I think I've taken enough of your time. Thanks for letting me stop in and listen.
Any time, Kapitän. It was a pleasure for me. Except for that noise you made at the end.
That noise wasn't coming from me. I thought something was wrong with the record.
Was ist... ?
I think I see the problem. It's time for us to make merry music with the Morganas once more.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: If I recall, Beethoven later revoked his support for Napoleon. He called him a tyrant.

Fields.DialogueText: What are you getting at?
I can't help but think he would put Hitler in the same category.

Fields.MenuText: I don't really care about ambition or glory. But music is good for the soul.

Fields.DialogueText: That, too. I just love to listen to grand music, even if I only faintly understand the meaning.
Perhaps the meaning is just how we interpret it.
You're observant. I love opera, but this is Beethoven.
Don't you dare! The Führer is the embodiment of the people, the will of Germany itself!
All of it? Are you sure?
Even if he originally dedicated it to Napoleon.
But we all make mistakes. After all, we aren't the Führer.
That's an interesting drinking cup you have there. It looks like a cow's horn.
Weil es eines ist! This is a classical drinking horn – just as the Wikinger und Walküren used, in their day.
... Anyway. Your cup? It looks kind of awkward to use for drinking, doesn't it?
Das muss so sein! And even if it were, does it not embody a sense of Nordic pride, the kind that serves us well in battle?

Fields.MenuText: What are you drinking, out of curiosity?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Water.
Doesn't that defeat the original purpose?
We're on patrol, Captain. Dienst ist Dienst und Schnaps ist Schnaps.
Ahhhh! So viel dazu!
Amazing. You got through it all really quickly.
Now to try it out as the other sort of horn. Los geht's!
*ALARM*
Ouch! Try to work on the tone a little. It was really loud and shaky.
Sehr witzig, Kapitän. That was the ship's alarm.
Get to battle stations right away!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Did you make it yourself?

Fields.DialogueText: Leider nein, it just came with me when I woke up. Perhaps I should try to make my own! --As soon as I learn how to do something like that.
Just don't get into trouble with some farmer because you decided to use his cow.

Fields.MenuText: If you say the word "Nordic" one more time...

Fields.DialogueText: What then, Kapitän?
Mockery. Relentless, merciless mockery. I bet I could find some Scandinavian crew members to help me out.
Don't be petty.
The... Vikings and Valkyries?
Ja, Kapitän. The heroes of the ancient world. Our Nordic forefathers and foremothers.
"Our?" We have crew from all over the world, and you'd do well to remember that.
A sad necessity of wartime. We could do better if it weren't for those witches.
Don't insult my crew to my face, Deutschland. You may be my Belle, but they're the ones who keep this ship running.
I thought your "Nordic ancestors" went to war drunk all the time? Or do you only want to emulate them when it suits you?
-- We can honour our ancestors without imitating their bad habits.
Besides- I admit it- I enjoy drinking out of a horn. It makes me feel like a true Valkyrie.
*yawns*
How is the night watch treating you?
If they keep us up any later, I'll have to start propping up my eyelids with sticks.
Hah! You need a little toughening up, that's all.
Believe me, that's the last thing I need.
Eine Walküre should be ready for anything. At any time of day, in any weather.
You really do think of yourself as a Valkyrie, don't you?
Natürlich! A Valkyrie is a proud, beautiful warrior who carries the souls of the just to their deserved reward. What else would you have me be, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: How about being more open-minded?
Wouldn't you rather be happy?
I mean, if you're happy being a soldier, that's one thing, but.

Fields.DialogueText: But? But?? Where is the but???
Of course I am happy! And if I were not happy, I would be a fool!
Why do you think I'm unhappy? I'm happy!
If I were unhappy, I would be a fool!
Somebody doth protest too much.
Well, in your case it means "more open to degeneracy." And that's out of the question.
Being respectful of others isn't degenerate. And it's essential to discipline and morale.
I'll show you how wrong you are!
I mean it!
Whatever you say, Val.
... Val? Who is Val?
You. You is Val.
Hä?
Val. As in Valkyrie? Like... a nickname?
Why would you give *me* a-
*ALARM*
Verdammt. How did I *not* see them coming?
Worry about that *after* we drive them off.
@BATTLE
What's got *you* in such a good mood? Should I be worried?
Hm? Was meinst du?
I have received permission from the OKM to begin a project.
Oh, boy, here we go.
I will document the life aboard with my Kamera. And our glorious victories, as well as the destruction of our enemies.
Oh, is that all?
Also, I'll send the pictures home. The Propagandeministerium can use them for publication purposes.
That way my people can see the dangers we master out here and steel their resolve.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, thank God, it's something *normal*.
Propaganda's important. I don't see why they'd have a problem with it.
If they've approved it, I'll sign off on it too.

Fields.DialogueText: Pinch me, I must be dreaming.
What?
You agreed with me on something.
You really don't have a high opinion of me, do you?
Considering some of the things your idols get up to? No. No, I don't.
Ja. I feared it might be too much of a distraction from the struggle, but they were on board.
You gave me something I could agree with.
... Pun very much intended.
You're forgiven.
We all need our distractions. They keep us human. ...Or, well, Belle-ish.
... Well, it *is* something normal.
And we're all grateful for it.
... I would like to be beyond that. But...
Whatever the case. Yes, I'm happy to support your project. It's basically what you're doing already. However-
However?
*ALARM*
Don't let it get in the way of what matters. Got it?
I am a warrior first and foremost.
@BATTLE
*CLICK*
Oh, das ist ein gutes Bild! Kapitän-
Little busy at the moment!
*BOOM!*
YES! LET IT BURN!
Get out of my way, Schlampe! You're throwing off my exposure balance-
MORE LIGHT! MORE HEAT!
You're killing my photographs!
What about the crew?!
Ja, ja, them as well!
@BATTLE
More.... light....
*BOOM*
Well. She may have made all my whites too bright, but she did look picturesque as she sank.
I thought you couldn't have a white that was too white.
If the light is wrong, the photograph won't develop properly- ah.
Was this supposed to be an allusion, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: I didn't say anything.
I see we understand each other better every day.
Who could ever have guessed, the fascist is insecure in her beliefs.

Fields.DialogueText: Pah, lächerlich!
I said *nothing*, you took it as an insult.
There is a difference between light and- and- and filth!
Is there? Really? Fascinating.
You didn't have to. I can tell you were-
You're not a mind reader, are you?
Oh, just hold your-
Are you about to say what I think you're going to say? Insubordination doesn't look good on you.
... You're right. I lost my temper. It will not happen again.
It had better not.
Hey, Val, how's it going?
Fine. No sign of Nixen yet.
Well, keep an eye out for them.
What is your problem with my name?
That's... listen, it's a bit long to say in battle, and a bit... well...
I like my name. Do not take it away from me.

Fields.MenuText: Take it away? What?

Fields.DialogueText: I do not want you to take my name away. What is hard to understand about that?
Sorry. I just thought it would be fun to give you a nickname. And after the fight we had-
I... suppose... you can call me "Val" if you really want to.
Really?
Ja, but not in front of everyone. We need to maintain discipline on board.
I understand.
A little frivolity now and then might keep you from exploding  at an inopportune time.
I don't think one's mood works like a pressure valve.
I disagree. If it weren't for these Nixen popping up everywhere, some of the ports that bother me might have reason to remember my visit for a very long time.
*ALARM*
For legal reasons, this conversation is now over.
"Might," I said. Such squeamishness.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I thought you liked being compared to a Valkyrie?
Well, that was bizarrely hostile.

Fields.DialogueText: And you *wouldn't* be hostile?
What?
It's the best name possible.
I do. And I'm very... flattered? But-
After the fight we had, you found it necessary to humble me. And while you did not have the political capital to do so through official channels-
Deutschland.
Yes.
Where the *hell* did you get the idea that a friendly nickname is meant to be a punishment?
... I was trying to reassure you that, regardless of what you ... believe. You're still part of my crew.
I'll treat you with the same respect - and extend the same hand of friendship - that I would to anyone who fights by my side.
... So you call me that name to remind yourself that we're friends?
Something like that.
With the caveat that you have to keep yourself under control. I don't want any more reports that you're making "non-Aryan" crewmembers uncomfortable.
I promise, all I do is monitor them.
Yeah. I'm asking you to stop.
What are you reading there?
A German novel about the Great War.
Oh yes? That sounds interesting. We might've lost the last war, but we fought heroically. We're unbroken and proud. Mind if I have a look?
Sure, here it is. It's called All Quiet...
On the Western Front!?
Hey, careful! Don't drop my things!
I should never even have touched it! This book of lies was completely correctly classified as harmful and subversive!
Deutschland...
It's a disgrace to the Reich! It's just trying to badmouth our heroic defense - as if we had willingly allowed ourselves to be overrun by all these barbarian hordes!
I thought it was pretty moving. You should try to read it sometime.
Nein! I don't have to! I don't have to bother myself with this filth.

Fields.MenuText: You can't learn if you can't subject yourself to different opinions.

Fields.DialogueText: It is nice that you are interested in German works, but... that one?
I guess you'll have to figure that out yourself.
Well, if you don't want *All Quiet*, can I have it back?
Nein. I am confiscating it.
Spoilsport.
We must avoid degeneracy if we want to be strong. I am doing you a favor. --One question.
So you are a little curious about what it says.
I never said that. In any case, this discussion can wait. Pacifists can say what they may, but peace will not come until every last one of our enemies is conquered.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: For the interest that Germany shows in the arts, their tolerance for different viewpoints is certainly very restricted...

Fields.DialogueText: That's because artistry is but a platform for elevating our culture to the next golden age. Therefore, we must be careful to make sure that everything serves to steer us the right way.
Right for whom?

Fields.MenuText: War may be necessary, but it is also important to recognize the potential costs. That is why books like this are important.

Fields.DialogueText: War is a glorious thing, and we should be proud to serve. There is nothing I regret. Nothing. Nothing...
The lady doth protest too much, methinks.
... Why are you scrubbing your hands like that?
I try to pick up a little from the culture of everyone aboard. With you around... I've read everything from Goethe to Mein Kampf.
You've read der Führer's book?! But- but-
But what?
The- the German Volk, of course.
Why? No one reads it just for fun.
Yeah, you got that right. It made my eyes glaze over. I hated every second of it.
Everyone has regrets. ...I regret that I spent hours of my life reading Mein Kampf.
Eben! Its style is way too heavy. Even the most ardent party soldiers don't read it on the side.
Mm?
Next time have at least the decency to read your filth in German.
So, why?
Deutschland, I wanted to talk to you about something.
Was denn, Kapitän?
Some of the reports I have been getting about you...
What did I do wrong? Is it about when I tripped the other day? It won't happen again!
It's not about that. It's more about how you are getting along with the crew, and with the other ships in the fleet.
Only some of them. Most are proper soldiers.
They want to see the Morganas beaten too, and that's our priority. They are all part of this fleet, and I expect you all to work together.
Oh, absolut, Kapitän. Don't you worry about that.

Fields.MenuText: Well, at least you're trying to work on it. That's a start.

Fields.DialogueText: Nobody is perfect, as the Yankees say. See? I'm already working on it.
For now, you need to accept that others have their own values and respect them.
Sure, but don't expect me to sacrifice my values for theirs.
Since when does respectful acceptance equal indoctrination?
*ALARM*
Are you ready, Deutschland?
Jederzeit, Kapitän.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: ... I'm glad you want to follow orders. But this is important for its own sake. I think it will be good for everyone's morale.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Interessant. I will try, of course.

Fields.MenuText: And what will you do to fulfill your orders in this regard?

Fields.DialogueText: Leave that to me.
I've been getting some reports that you haven't been cooperating well with them.
Remember what I said before? You need to keep yourself under control.
Is that meant to breed confidence?
Some of them seem to think that there's a racial angle.
The ones who would say that want to see the Reich fail. It's just-
Think fast!
Ah!
*CLICK*
Ach herrje! I'm not sure that one will even be worth developing.
Why not?
Too close to degenerate art.  Not uplifting at all.
I want to capture emotion in my photographs, but there's a fine line between... emotional and ugly.

Fields.MenuText: Are you calling me ugly?
Maybe you can't have one without the other.
You can try to take it again?

Fields.DialogueText: It won't be the same. The surprise won't be genuine.
... Art is supposed to cheer the spirit. If it makes you feel bad...
Was?! Nein, nein, no, no, you're - you're extremely good-looking! It is the art that's ugly.
Relax. I'm yanking your chain.
Fair enough.
... We'll have to agree to disagree. Again.
*ALARM*
Well! Here's the chance for some *beautiful* art.
Let's hope there's no "glory" in it.
Don't be ridiculous. That's what I meant!
@BATTLE
Attention, all hands! We are under attack! Prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
That takes care of this lot.
For now, at least. They'll be back, sooner or later.
That only means we will have to break them to pieces again. Nothing to worry about.
But the Morganas *do* worry me. We don't really know where they came from or what they are.
Well, I have a theory.
Really?
Ja. I think they may be children of Naglfar.
Who... or what...  is that?
A death ship made of the fingernails of the deceased. It serves as the flagship of Muspell and will sail when Ragnarök comes.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think we will have to face Naglfar herself by the end of it all?

Fields.DialogueText: Who knows? I hope so, though. I look forward to the challenge.
So you think these things came straight from Hell?
Nein, more Muspelheim. I wonder if it is possible to travel the other way?
You want to go to the underworld?
Not really, but it would be fascinating to sail some of the other branches of Yggdrasil. Plus, you know me – I love to raid enemies right where they think they're safe.
Let's keep an eye out for any Morganas that have the same ideas.

Fields.MenuText: Still doesn't help us figure out how to finish them off for good.

Fields.DialogueText: On the contrary! We are heirs to the heroes of old, and that will give us the strength to banish such evil to the depths of darkness.
That's one way to look at it.

Fields.MenuText: Does that mean Ragnarok is coming?

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps, perhaps not. Either way, we must do what we can to fight, with no fear of death.
Dun, dun dun, dun dun dun dun dun DUN-
Val? What are you doing in there?
Aaaah! Don't come in!
What?
You're going to let the light in!
The... light? Deutschland, are you okay?
I am developing my photographs. If you come in, I might lose them!
Fair enough. How long are you going to be in there?
Well, it is half an hour for each photo to develop, and I took probably seventy photos...
And while multiple photos can dry at a time...
Good grief.
Is there a problem?

Fields.MenuText: No. Just make sure you're ready if you're needed.
Some of your photos might become martyrs for the cause, if you're not careful.
Yes, there's a problem. You can't take up an entire maintenance closet for your hobby.

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän, if I cannot take photos, I'm going to give more of my time and attention to the glory of the Reich.
If you hate my ideology so much, maybe you should pick your battles, ja?
All right, all right. Just.... be prepared to move your things if we need to.
Oh, I am fully aware. The ones in front of the door are the least important.
All right, just checking.
Kapitän! Of *course* I will *always* be ready.
My hobbies are *much* less important than our war.
*ALARM*
Ach!
Time to put your money where your mouth is, huh?
I'm coming, I'm coming! Just let me protect these last few photos-
...Heh.
What?? Did I do something wrong?
Nope. I'm just glad you're having a good time.
@BATTLE
Is that envelope what I think it is?
Ja, es sind meine Fotos. I'm sending them home today.
... I just hope they're well-liked.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure they will be.
If they aren't, we all know your bosses have no sense of taste.
I liked the ones you showed me.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke, Kapitän. But.... it doesn't really matter what either of us think.
Forgive me if I can't take that seriously. You read degenerate literature for fun.
Danke, Kapitän. I want to believe you.
Fun and understanding. But I see your point.
I just... I want them to take me seriously. I want to make art that inspires the soul to greatness. Art like Leni's.
Leni Riefenstahl?
Mmhm! She's a master at emotion. The framing of her shots, the composition, the *music*-
*sigh*
*Was ist?* Why are you giving me *that* look?
I've seen your photos, Val. You can aspire to better than flattering pictures of Nazi rallies.
What's wrong with them? If they bring out the meaning in the moments they capture-
*You can do better than that.* You can make art. Real art. That doesn't need to manipulate you into believing things.
As I said. The Kamera doesn't lie.
Mm. The camera can ... omit things, though. If someone's standing behind the photographer... they won't be in the shot. Right?
*ALARM*
Well. Someone is standing behind us. Shall we kill them?
Ready whenever you are.
@BATTLE
DUN dun DUN- nein, das stimmt nicht...
What are you working on? That doesn't look like our reports...
Nein, ist es auch nicht.
Is that sheet music?
Ja. ... I compose occasionally.
Huh. That makes a lot of sense, now that I think about it.
Danke. This will be my masterpiece. If I can ever finish it.
Is it a symphony?
An opera.
It is the story of a Walküre during the last days of Ragnarök.
She does what she can to lead her rescued heroes to the defense of the Gods. But as the whole Earth burns, she realizes there is nothing left to defend.
She throws herself into combat with the Jötnar. She slays one- two- three- and the warriors she's led follow behind her-
She rallies them all for one final glorious charge - and slays a Jötunngeneral! But as he's dying- his spear goes through her ribs-
... Did you just mime stabbing yourself through the ribcage?
... Ähm, ja. It is a glorious death, is it not?
And the Valkyrie. Is she you?
Was? I don't understand.
And as she lays dying, she sings one final aria, about her Nordic spirit and the glory she has earned, even if her deeds will never be remembered.
... The way you describe it, you make it sound like you're writing about yourself.
Like *you* want to die as the world burns around you. With a spear through your ribs.
Listen. I don't want to be having this conversation either.
But if you want to die- we need to do something about that.
....There are things I want to do first. Not many. But there are.

Fields.MenuText: That's not good enough. You need a real sense of self-preservation.
If you need help- I'm here for you.
...I'm *worried* about you.

Fields.DialogueText: And I have it. Until I finish my opera and my photography, I do not want to die.
If I'm ever in need of a Hagen, I will let you know.
Sarcasm? I'm just trying to help.
... I don't deserve your worry. Mir geht es gut, Kapitän.
... I'll trust you. But... please be careful. You're not just risking your own life.
Those two sentences do *not* go together.
*ALARM*
I will kill these Nixen... carefully.
(Let's hope none of them have spears...)
@BATTLE
Mail call, Deutschland. You got a letter from the Kriegsmarine...
Is it about my Fotos? Can I see?
I'd bet my hat it is. Here you go.
They sent my photos to Goebbels himself! And... oh.
... Something wrong? You just deflated like a balloon.
...They approved exactly two of the photographs for publication.
And? I thought you'd be excited about that...
....Two, out of seventy-odd. And they weren't even the *best* ones!
I can understand why they didn't like the seagulls... or the sunrise... or the Küste of the Vaterland... those won't exactly raise patriotic fervor in anyone...
But they didn't even like number 42, and that's the best Foto I've ever taken!
Didn't it have Midshipman Freedman in the background?
... Oh. He's not exactly Aryan, that's true. But that doesn't affect the quality of the Foto itself, does it?
Well, I can see why your bosses wouldn't like it.
It was a simple mistake. -- They didn't like number 13 either, and that one was *beautiful*. The play of light on the hulls-
-- The hulls of our *allied* League ships? The ones who aren't German?
Stimmt. But they could put a positive spin on it!
... Face it, Val, they're not going to like your art when it's good.
But *why?* I worked to make it *perfekt*.

Fields.MenuText: Good art transcends nation and creed.
Good art includes everyone. Including people who aren't "Nordic."
Good art has too much emotion. They think it's degenerate.

Fields.DialogueText: Papperlappap! Pride is a very strong emotion. Your argument makes no sense.
That is not wahr! You don't include everyone in a Portrait. And good art emboldens the Nordic spirit within us-
Trotzdem... the Volk is important. You cannot make good art without-
*ALARM*
Well... here comes your chance for another photo op.
What's the point? They didn't like the last one.
@BATTLE
Attention, crew, we have a Morgana situation! Prepare to engage!
@BATTLE
Well, that's finally done with. Hopefully none of them got away.
Don't worry about that, Kapitän. I was keeping track.
Good job, Val. You're good at lying in wait.
Danke. Although... you don't *have* to call me a nickname.
Do you *want* me to stop?
... Nein. I enjoy... your warmth on a personal level. But on a political level... it's... unwelcome.
What do you mean?
My personal name is a privilege, not a right. A nickname feels like ... an attempt to circumvent that.
Val. What the hell are you talking about?
As Deutschland, I embody the Fatherland. An important, auspicious title. I am blessed to bear that name... for now.
Everyone makes mistakes. That doesn't mean they get to take away your *name.*
Oh doch! They might decide to take it away and give it to someone else. A stronger or more perfect Walküre. And I would have to accept that.
You would just go along with whatever they decided?
It is my duty to accept the OKM's commands and their assessments of my performance. If they decide to strip me of my name, who am I to say they're wrong?
I'm your immediate commanding officer, and my reports make your competence clear. You don't need to worry that I'll take your name away.
I know my place. And I know *you* wouldn't be the one to decide my name.

Fields.MenuText: Regardless, a rose by a different name is still a rose. Whatever name you have, you'll still be you, Deutschland.

Fields.DialogueText: A sweet thought, Kapitän. Well worth mangling Shakespeare for.
Only time will tell, I suppose. But in any case, for the moment, you are still Deutschland, the occasionally exasperating yet determined hero of the oceans.
Danke, Kapitän. I accept.
Now, come on. This fight's been long. We need rest and food.

Fields.MenuText: As long as we're out here, you can go by whatever name you want.

Fields.DialogueText: That smacks of sedition, Kapitän, but I believe your heart is in the right place.
Sedition, nothing. Just be who you want to be.

Fields.MenuText: Whenever I think of the word Deutschland, I will always think of you.

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän, danke. I've trained you well.
But I keep making... mistakes. Little ones, and ... big ones. Sometimes very big.
... So, uh. For one thing.
Ich bin direkt hinter dir.
Still in a bad mood, Val?
I cannot stop thinking about the pictures.
The ones your bosses didn't like?
And the ones they did.
They were proud of me. Proud enough to name me after the Fatherland.
But something changed and I don't know what it was. They do not like me the way they used to.

Fields.MenuText: Of course they like you. You're an incredible asset to them.
Maybe you're just not used to their... more politically-motivated sensibilities?
You worry too much. It'll be fine.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Worrying is for people with something to hide, Kapitän. If I am worried, I am hiding something from them.
Or from yourself?
I am. But if I am not careful, that might become past tense.
... You're not going to die, Val. I promise.
... I know what you believe, and I cannot accept it. And even if I could...
I exist because of the Kriegsmarine. OKM can do with me as they please.
I owe them an enormous debt of gratitude.
It's going to be all right, Val. If they can't like you for who you are, that's their mistake. Not yours.
... I'm starting to think that the only way they'll like me is if I... I...
... If I find my moment of glory, Kapitän.
For the love of-
If I am sunk, a martyr to the cause, and reborn perfected. Maybe I'll be someone worth fighting for. Maybe I won't make as many mistakes.
No. That's not how that works. You're a person, not-
Nein, Kapitän! This is ganz genau how I will suceed in becoming a heroine and worthy of my name!
And what about-
*ALARM*
....*Damn*. That's a big armada.
... Bigger than most. I think they're within our capacities.
If you think so,  we'll engage. But-- Val?
Ja?
Don't do anything... foolish. You still have an opera to finish, right?
Da hast du Recht. A true heroine should be remembered for more than just one fight. I have to build a legacy!
@BATTLE
...This is it. It looks like they've surrounded some civilian ships.
Verbündete oder Alliierte?
Does it matter?
If they're French or British, maybe we let the Nixen finish them off. Get them when they're distracted.
You get ruthless when you feel unwanted, don't you?
As it turns out, they're flying the Italian flag. And your moment of hesitation could have screwed them.
... The crew's working. They'll be fine.

Fields.MenuText: Don't get sullen with me.
Let's not dwell on it. We got people to save.
A civilian is a civilian, period.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, ja, schon gut. Spare me the Geneva sermon. I know the-
Can your bullshit. We're in the business of saving lives, not judging them.
Hopefully they're people.
I wasn't being sullen. I just want to do what's best for the Reich, and that means not wasting resources on inferior-
*Verstanden, Kapitän.*
@BATTLE
*CRACK*
RAT-TAT-TAT RAT-TAT-TAT
They broke the window! Stay out of the line of fire.
I am not a child, Kapitän!
Never said you were!
*BOOM!*
The whole starboard side of the deck's on fire! I'm going to help put it out-
I'll come too.
No, stay here. We need you keeping the Mist off.
Verstanden, komme nach!
*BOOM*
*RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT*
Smoke's so thick - hard to breathe, even with a cloth over my mouth-
IT'S A PLEASURE TO BURN!
Someone shut her up!
Damn- feeling- faint-
Too much smoke-
So much light- and is there- is that an angel?
Kapitän! Take my Hand!
Nn-
That's it. I got you.
Get the Kapitän some medical attention! I'll handle the Nixen.
@BATTLE
Stuck in my sickbed... ugh...
Hope everyone's all right.
Good to see you're still with us.
Thank you. I'm as surprised as you.
Well, we cannot *all* be invincible. Sometimes you need a Walküre to save your life.
... About that.
*Ja? Was ist?*
... You had your moment of glory right there. I was dying trying to put out that fire.
I would have made a pretty goddamn picture, wouldn't I? But you saved my life, instead.
Why?
I'm pretty sure the OKM and Ministerium wouldn't like it if I let my Kapitän die just for a pretty Foto.
The way you phrase that makes it sound like it isn't the whole reason.
If I can't die, you can't either.
We'll fade together in a glorious death or not at all!

Fields.MenuText: I can't tell if I think that's inspiring or presumptuous.
I'm just glad we're both alive.
Good. You deserve a fighting chance.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't I have enough fighting chances?
No, I mean, to be a good person. To be loved. To do the right thing.
.... I have all of that already, Kapitän.
Then why aren't you happy?
Well, if you can make that decision for me, I can make that decision for you, nein?
... Fair enough. No one has to die today.
I am too.
Wait, what?
Did I just catch you saying death is a bad thing?
Indeed.
Was? Nein!
Oh, speaking of heavy things. I have something of yours that needs returning.
Something of mine? What...?
*ALARM*
I will be back with it as soon as the crisis is over!
....She's such a *strange* girl.
@BATTLE
I'm returning your trash, Kapitän.
All Quiet on the Western Front? I thought you confiscated this.
Stimmt. And I'm returning it to you because I'm your Schiff and I had no Recht to seize it from my Kapitän.
Ah. I see.
Why are you giving me *that* look?

Fields.MenuText: You could have thrown it in the ocean.
Ah, I never thought I'd see this again. That's all.
You *liked* it, didn't you?

Fields.DialogueText: I absolutely did not.
To be honest, I did not think you would either.
I could have. But it was *yours*. It felt wrong to throw it away.
So, how was it?
It's a blot on Germany's heritage.
It was depressing. It made a mockery of the bravery of our soldiers. It - it made it seem like nothing they did *mattered*.
So why'd you finish it?
Because I mean to convince you that it's rubbish.
... How so?
I will show you with our battles how we make a difference.
The Autor was just dumm. But that's not what this is about.
The point is- Do you have more?
More what?
*ALARM*
More Nixen to kill, I *guess*.
Somehow I get the feeling that that wasn't what you were going to say...
@BATTLE
And how this can lead to happiness. Fulfillment!
So, you wanted more of something, huh? And you asked to speak to me privately about it?
Ja, Kapitän.
Are we about to "fraternize?"
Only if you want to. That wasn't my original intent.
Then let's hear it.
What else is on your bookshelf? I want to see more of it.
... I assume you mean the "degenerate" works?
Ja. You have more of them, I know you do, and I want to read them.
Why on earth would you want to do that?
You read Mein Kampf to understand my beliefs. And even though you hated every second of it, you finished it.
It is only fair that I show you the same courtesy. Also, what can du anbieten me?

Fields.MenuText: You want to understand me?
Fair's fair, I guess. Well, how about some older classics for a start?
Be my guest.

Fields.DialogueText: I want to know why you believe what you believe so I can train you out of it.
I want to know my enemy so I can defeat it.
And here I was thinking there might be hope for you after all.
Never let it be said that I don't treat people fairly.
Emphasis on the 'people', mm?
Of course.
Wait, you're not going to interrogate my motives?
Why would I? You told me what you wanted and why.
And you think "I want to understand you" is a good enough reason for me to want to read.... trash?
Obviously.
As long as you give it back, you can read anything out of my library you want. Heck, I'll make recommendations.
You have a *wide* variety of trash, don't you?
Slavic... Slavic... subhuman.... perverted... oh, my, even more perverted. Oho, also that Art of Schund I should've expected. Is that Gneisenau-
No, you don't. Does anything actually look interesting?
I... well...
*ALARM*
I'll decide *after* we hunt down these Nixen.
Fine by me. Let's get 'em!
@BATTLE
Let's move on.
Also I have to say, Kapitän....
I still can't get over it.
You saved my life.
Of course. You are my Kapitan.
You just... don't strike me as the hero type.
What?! That's all I've ever wanted to be.
... I like Kameras, and I like Walküren. And I like both because of their *heroic spirit*.
... I don't ... understand.
The Kamera doesn't lie. It tells you what you need to see. It shows you the world so you can act.
The Walküre saves dying heroes. She takes them to Walhalla, where all wounds are healed and all battles are glorious.
I want to be a Kamera. I want to be a Walküre. I *want* to be a hero for the Reich.
... A hero of the Reich wouldn't have saved my life.
Of course she would!
Mm.
... As much as you dislike it, you are my commanding Offizier, and therefore connected to the Reich. And... something more than that, to me.
... You think I am worthy of my name. You think I am worthy of my deeds.
I do.
... Whether you like it or not, you are part of my struggle. You are worth fighting for.
We will stand side by side. We will fight. We *will* bring the world to a new Golden Age.
And if I don't want your Golden Age?
We'll see eye to eye in the end.

Fields.MenuText: As long as the Morganas are here? I'm happy to fight by your side.
I don't know about that. But maybe we don't have to.

Fields.DialogueText: You... would die for *me*?
You care *so much* about the world. You have a strong sense of duty and fairness and you love so keenly it burns.
I think I could love you. I just can't love the roads you've chosen to walk.
Danke for the meal, Kapitan. And for the offer of wine, though of course, I must refuse.

Fields.MenuText: You're fine. More for me.

Fields.DialogueText: I think you've had a little too much.
Two glasses with a meal is *fine*, Val. Besides, I've been overthinking. I need to calm down.
Overthinking what?
We'll walk the same road, someday. I'll train you to it.
No, you won't. But one way or another, we'll find a path to walk together.
And I am *more* than happy to fight by yours.
Cheers, I'll drink to that.
To saving lives. Mine, yours, and anyone else we happen across.
*Clink*
Pfleh! Drinking out of a horn is harder than I thought.
Keep at it. You'll get the hang of it one of these days.
I'm sure you'll laugh at me the entire time.
Only if you're laughing, too. I like your mistakes.
And I like yours. Starting with believing in me.
I hope that isn't a mistake.
Mm. I guess time will tell.

Fields.MenuText: I guess I brought it up here for nothing, then.

Fields.DialogueText: Part of a general pattern of overthinking, maybe.
It's funny. For all the grief I've given you about wanting to die heroically, I've been thinking about my own brush with death.
And, y'know, if the mist had gotten me while I was trying to save *you*... I think I would have been okay with that.
